divs: sighting detailsi live in sw fort worth, about five miles east of benbrook and about two miles east of benbrook lake. my dish went out six or seven times last night, one after the other, during a period of about an hour and ten minutes. it started at 8:00 and ended about 9:10. the sky was clear and the stars bright. it's only gone out during storms before. it first went out right at 8pm, seconds after "comanche moon" started. after finding the signal again, it came on for a few minutes then went out again. after about the third time i thought about something blocking the signal. thinking of the stephenville incident, i went outside to see if that ufo was was out there. i didn't see anything, but while i was out there the naval air station (the old carswell afb) sent up 3 to 5 jets that came south from the base and then turned to the west southwest. i'm about ten miles south of the base and the dublin\stephenville area is about 50 miles to the wsw. after about the third outage i called direct tv tech help and got no one, holding for what seemed like over ten minutes. after about the fifth time i called again, holding again and never speaking to anyone, but this time the phone was filled with so much static it was unbearable, and i hung up. the phone was land line, not my cell phone. i went back outside again to look up into the night, and again saw nothing but stars in a beautiful night sky. i'm reporting this because all of these incidents have never happened before, and i thought it was ironic in light of the reports coming out of stephenville on the 14th -- something one mile long and one-half mile wide -- the service interruptions, the jets, the static, etc. maybe you can use this to help piece the puzzle together. richard barron fort worth
trends: There have been 4 other sightings in Benbrook
There were no other sightings in Benbrook on or around January 15th 2008
Summary: Wierd occurances in the SW sky
